Game Version: NFS Most Wanted 1.3 \nGame Type: Circuit/Sprint \n• Participants Controllers, Steering Wheel allowed.
• At the end of each match, players must maintain the final screens and receive confirmation from a referee.
• Winning a race: The winner of a race is the first player to finish 1st in sprint or 3 laps of the circuit course and cross the finish line.
• A participant will be informed about the exact time of their match when they report.
• A participant has to report at the Venue with respect to the scheduled time table.
• No participant shall be allowed to participate if he/she does not report to the organizing authority within their reporting time.
• A participant might have to wait for a maximum of 2 hours before his/her round begins.
• If a participant is found missing before the round then the opponent shall be awarded a walkover to the next round.
• No participant shall be allowed to participate in a round after the round finished.
• Only USB devices shall be allowed to be connected. NO PS2 devices allowed.
• No headphones shall be provided. Please bring your own headphones if necessary.
• Again a referee’s decision has to be accepted by the participants and no arguments shall be accepted.
• Only USB Pen-Drive is allowed for copying setup files of GamePads. (NO CD-ROM Drive available).
• If a gamer has registered in more than one game, then it’s up to the sole discretion of the committee to disqualify him/her from any of the games in case of a time clash.
\nCar Settings: • Visual Upgrade allowed.
• Part, Performance (Pro, Super Pro, Ultimate)allowed, Junkman not allowed.
• Personal save files are NOT allowed.
• Cars may be tuned before racing each course.
\nGame Settings: Courses : Diamond, Dunwich Bay, Heritage Heights, Bay Bridge, East Park
The Course selection may be changed prior to the tournament. Players will be informed of any such changes before the tournament.
• Race Mode Options : Circuit/Sprint
• Track Direction : Forward
• LAPS : 3
• N20 : On
• Collision Detection : Off
• Performance Matching : On
• Min Num. Players : 2
\nPlayer Options: • Game Moment Camera : Off
• Car Damage : Off
• Rearview Mirror: Player's own discretion
• Units : Player’s own discretion
\nBasic Round: • In this round sprint and circuit races will be played.
• Four participants will be competing in this round. 3)
• With this process 1 participant will be the winner after the race and will be advanced to next round.
\nAdvance Rounds: • In these rounds there will be 1 race between each of the 4 participants.
• Four participants will be competing in this round.
• The race will be sprint or the circuit depending upon the stuation.
• The participants winning the race will be in the semi final.
• This process will be continued until we get top 16 participants.
\nSemi Finals: • In semi finals there will be 2 races ammoung the 8 participants.
• Eight participants will be competing in this round.
• At the end of the race the participant standing in 1st and 2nd position will be qualified for the final round.
\nFinals: • In finals there will be 1 race between participants.
• Four participants will be competing in this round 3.
• The loop for this race will be NFS World Loop.
\nDisconnect: • Disconnection: Any disconnection of the connection between match players due to System, Network, PC, and/or Power problems/issues
• Intentional Disconnection: Upon judgment by the referee, any offending player will be charged with a loss by forfeit
• When any disconnection occurs:
• If the disconnection is deemed to be unintentional by the referee, the match will be restarted. If any player does not agree to a match restart, that player will lose by default.
\nPenalty for Unfair Play • Unfair play
• Use of any cheat program
• Intentional disconnection
• Use of any settings exceeding standard and permitted settings
• If the match is disrupted due to unnecessary chatting, the player may be given a warning or lose by default at the referee’s sole discretion.
• Upon discovery of any player committing any violations regarded as unfair play, that player will be disqualified from the tournament.
• During the course of any match, the operations staff and/or referee may determine other actions to be unfair play at any time.
• Two warnings constitute being disqualified from the tournament.
